clinical_study.brief_title: EcoAnaesthesia Facemask Versus Standard Facemask During Anesthesia Induction
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of the Efficiency of the New EcoAnaesthesia Facemask With a Standard Facemask During Induction of Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficiency of the EcoAnesthesia mask and its advantages over the standard facemask used in our practice. The satisfaction by the anesthesia provider and its ease of use may change the standard practice in airway management. In addition to these additional effects on patient safety, the facemask is affordable and may reduce the environmental burden of anesthesia waste.

primary_outcome.description: End-tidal oxygen concentration after 3 minutes with the mask that the patient was first randomized to use.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of 3 minutes with each mask
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum airway pressure, which will be necessary to reach a tidal volume of at least 6 ml/kg every minute during the 3 minutes of mask ventilation with each device.

arm_group.description: Both the "standard adult facemask" (Portex Adult, USA) and the new facemask (EcoAnesthesia Mask, Intersurgical, Inc., Liverpool, NY, USA) will be tested in each patient for three minutes. The order of usage of each mask will be randomly assigned to each patient. This group will receive the EcoAnesthesia Mask first.
